title: Transnational Mathematics Education Through Collaborative Teaching: Knowledge Sharing Models in the COVID-19 Era

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of fundamental math concepts and basic digital device usage skills
context.additional_context: Necessity to build a smartphone-based collaborative learning culture in limited technological environments due to COVID-19. Goal is to enhance mathematical proficiency through knowledge sharing and social interaction among learners

learning_goals: Learners can explain mathematical concepts with over 80% accuracy during collaborative problem-solving processes with peers using smartphones.
Learners can share weekly learning content at least three times and exchange feedback using online collaboration tools.

Learners can understand transnational education models in the context of COVID-19 and present learning cases applying the four knowledge conversion processes (socialization, externalization, combination, and internalization) in digital environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
